content:
For Twitter and Github, the user shouldn't be able to enter their own Label and Hint, right?
E.g. we'll want to specify in the label/hint that they should just enter their GitHub username, not github.com/username.

also possibly we should just ask for URLs instead of usernames? E.g. both GitHub and GitLab have on-prem versions.
And then we can show one of
[rishig]
[View profile]

in the user's profile depending on whether we can automatically extract the username or not.
I think the userbase of the on-premise versions is small enough that those folks can use the "custom" feature for it.

For Label/Hint: I'm not sure. Probably we should just use the standard values, but we should make sure we have a clear standard labeling practice for whether it's "GitHub", "GitHub username", etc.

@Yashashvi Dave FYI.
I think not allowing custom labels and hints will also work better with a future oauth flow?

Yeah, I think it's reasonable to not allow custom labels/hints there. I can see uses, especially for "hint", but it's probably something we should see if anyone needs be waiting for someone to complain.
In that case we might need to change the order, so that "Type" comes first?
